intro: Oxalis cordata, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Oxalis cordata is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
